void LogStream::message ( int  verbosity,
const std::string &  log,
bool  delimiter = true 
) [virtual]

A message to be processed by the stream.

Parameters:
verbosity - What level of verbosity is associated with this message, higher number == more verbosity.
log - Message that is to be processed.
delimiter - Should a delimiter be emitted as well?

Definition at line 107 of file LogStream.cpp.

References m_Out, and m_Profile.

void LogStream::progressBegin ( int  verbosity,
const std::string &  msg,
int  total 
) [virtual]

Begin a progress reporting.

After this initial call the progressStep call will be called N times where N = the parameter total passed in below.

Parameters:
verbosity - What level of verbosity is the progress associated with. Higher levels of verbosity produce more messages.
msg - String message associated with the beginning of this task.
total - Expected number of times that the progressStep() will be called after this.

Implements ProgressHandler.

Parameters:

msg - Closing message from calling function.

Definition at line 184 of file LogStream.cpp.

References getDouble(), m_Out, m_Profile, m_ProgressTimeStart, and m_ProgressTotal.

void LogStream::progressStep ( int  verbosity  )  [virtual]

This function is called when one unit of work has been done.

In general it is expected that the units of work should be roughly equal in size.

Parameters:
verbosity - At what verbosity levell should this step be displayed.

Implements ProgressHandler.

What level of verbosity is requested.

We force lots of output here.

Parameters:
verbosity - Level below which progress messages are printed.
